1.text: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend that you may know prudence.

2.text: I will give you a good gift, forsake not my law.

3.text: For I also was my fatherâ€™s son, tender and as an only son in the sight of my mother:

4.text: And he taught me, and said: Let thy heart receive my words, keep my commandments, and thou shalt live.

5.text: Get wisdom, get prudence: forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth.

6.text: Forsake her not, and she shall keep thee: love her, and she shall preserve thee.

7.text: The beginning of wisdom, get wisdom, and with all thy possession purchase prudence.

8.text: Take hold on her, and she shall exalt thee: thou shalt be glorified by her, when thou shalt embrace her.

9.text: She shall give to thy head increase of graces, and protect thee with a noble crown.

10.text: Hear, O my son, and receive my words, that years of life may be multiplied to thee.

11.text: I will shew thee the way of wisdom, I will lead thee by the paths of equity:

12.text: Which when thou shalt have entered, thy steps shall not be straitened, and when thou runnest thou shalt not meet a stumblingblock.

13.text: Take hold on instruction, leave it not: keep it, because it is thy life.

14.text: Be not delighted in the paths of the wicked, neither let the way of evil men please thee.

15.text: Flee from it, pass not by it: go aside, and forsake it.

16.text: For they sleep not except they have done evil: and their sleep is taken away unless they have made some to fall.

17.text: They eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of iniquity.

18.text: But the path of the just, as a shining light, goeth forwards and increaseth even to perfect day.

19.text: The way of the wicked is darksome: they know not where they fall.

20.text: My son, hearken to my words, and incline thy ear to my sayings.

21.text: Let them not depart from thy eyes, keep them in the midst of thy heart:

22.text: For they are life to those that find them, and health to all flesh.

23.text: With all watchfulness keep thy heart, because life issueth out from it.

24.text: Remove from thee a froward mouth, and let detracting lips be far from thee.

25.text: Let thy eyes look straight on, and let thy eyelids go before thy steps.

26.text: Make straight the path for thy feet, and all thy ways shall be established.

27.text: Decline not to the right hand, nor to the left: turn away thy foot from evil. For the Lord knoweth the ways that are on the right hand: but those are perverse which are on the left hand. But he will make thy courses straight, he will bring forward thy ways in peace.
